summary: This document is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to Verizon, dated June 22, 2020, demanding phone records and subscriber information for specific phone numbers and time periods (1999-2012) as part of a criminal investigation into violations of federal statutes related to sex trafficking and child exploitation. It includes a cover letter requesting confidentiality and a declaration form for the custodian of records.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: Issued and signed the grand jury subpoena and cover letter as the Acting U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: Authored the cover letter and is the signatory on the subpoena, requesting Verizon's compliance and confidentiality.

events.title: Grand Jury Appearance Date for Verizon
events.description: Verizon is commanded to appear before the Grand Jury at the U.S. Courthouse in Foley Square, New York, to testify and produce documents, though appearance can be waived if records are produced to the FBI by that date.

events.title: Issuance of Grand Jury Subpoena
events.description: The subpoena is issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office, demanding Verizon produce extensive phone and subscriber records for specified time periods as part of a criminal investigation.

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY
United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Manhattan, New York, NY
keyFacts: The subpoena targets phone records and subscriber information from Verizon for the periods 01/01/1999 through 12/31/2012 and 01/01/2011 through 12/31/2012, indicating a broad historical investigation.

The investigation involves alleged violations of U.S. criminal codes 18 U.S.C. §§ 2422 (coercion and enticement), 2251 (sexual exploitation of children), 2252 (certain activities relating to material involving the sexual exploitation of minors), and 2252A (certain activities relating to material constituting or containing child pornography).

The U.S. Attorney's Office explicitly requests Verizon to voluntarily refrain from disclosing the existence of the subpoena to any third party to preserve the confidentiality of the grand jury investigation.

The subpoena allows Verizon to avoid a personal appearance by producing the requested documents to an FBI Special Agent at 26 Federal Plaza, New York, by the return date of July 6, 2020, accompanied by a completed Declaration of Custodian of Records.
The document is part of the EFTA00102050 series and is signed by Audrey Strauss in her capacity as Acting United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York in June 2020.
